All inbound travelers are required to undergo 14 days of quarantine. Individuals are required to provide their quarantine address and a contact number to concerned authorities.
Those who have not received at least two doses of a COVID-19 vaccination at least 14 days previously or who are unable to provide proof of having recovered from COVID-19 within the previous 4 months are required to self-isolate for 14 days on arrival. International Restrictions:
*Entry to Mongolia: It is currently not possible for British nationals without long-stay visas, residence permits or business visas for Mongolia to enter Mongolia. You should contact the Mongolian Embassy for the most up-to-date advice on entry requirements. All scheduled international commercial flights and rail are suspended. All road border crossings to and from Russia are closed to foreign nationals. Borders between China and Mongolia are closed.
The Mongolian government allows foreign nationals to travel to Mongolia on incoming flights if they meet certain criteria (a valid long-stay visa, permanent residency or short term business visas). All incoming passengers are required to provide evidence of a negative COVID-19 PCR test taken no more than 72 hours before arrival and take another PCR test on arrival at Chinggis Khan International Airport (unless aged 5 or under). Those who have not received at least two doses of a COVID-19 vaccination at least 14 days previously or who are unable to provide proof of having recovered from COVID-19 within the previous 4 months are required to self-isolate for 14 days on arrival. Those who have evidence of receiving two doses of a COVID-19 vaccination at least 14 days previously or of having recovered from COVID-19 within the previous 4 months are exempt from isolation requirements.
*Demonstrating your COVID-19 status: Mongolia will accept the proof of COVID-19 recovery and vaccination record. Your appointment card from vaccination centres is not designed to be used as proof of vaccination and should not be used to demonstrate your vaccine status.
*Visas: Any Foreign nationals who need to extend their visas should contact the Immigration Agency of Mongolia, telephone +976 1800 1882 or +976 9314 1009.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Mongolia: Precautionary measures introduced by the Mongolian authorities include:
• restrictions on public gatherings
• fines for not wearing a mask in public
• the suspension of all scheduled international commercial air and rail routes. You should check the status of any upcoming flights or trains into and out of Mongolia with your airline/booking agent
• the closure to foreign nationals of road crossings between Mongolia and Russia
• the closure of all borders between China and Mongolia until further notice
• the cancellation of all domestic flights except for charters
In addition to the above, the Government of Mongolia has placed the country under an “Orange Level” status, or “partial heightened state of readiness”.
*Accommodation: You will likely need to wear a mask in indoor public areas of your accommodation, and your temperature may be checked upon entry. Hotels need to carry out regular cleaning and sanitising measures as per government guidance.
*Public places and services: You may be fined if you do not wear a mask in public. Shops, bars and restaurants have social distancing measures in place.
*If you test positive for COVID-19 in Mongolia you will be asked to self-isolate and will be contacted by your nearest medical facility who will discuss your symptoms and offer further guidance. You should follow any guidance given by the Mongolian authorities. Local medical facilities may not always have English speakers so if you require help with translation.
